title: When a share is removed from one device, other devices should be notified

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
I noticed something unexpected when I remove a shared folder from a device (let's call it A): soon, all my other devices that share the same folder try to push it again to A, as if A never had that folder in the first place. The only way to stop them sending notifications is to go to each device's UI and un-select A from the list of devices sharing the folder.

I believe this behaviour is troublesome and counter-intuitive: to stop one device from sharing that folder, I also need to tweak all the other devices. A non-expert user could get very confused and not know how to fix the issue at all. What I would expect is for device A to tell the others: "I had that folder, I don't want it anymore, stop sharing it with me".
Technically, I'd say that upon deletion, A should remember the devices that were sharing the folder at that time, and try to notify each of them of the deletion. When a device is actually notified, A can forget about him having the folder. When all the devices are notified, A can finally forget about the folder altogether.

I experienced this with device A being an android smartphone, with syncthing-android v0.9.6 (latest on f-droid) and syncthing v0.14.22-rc.1+12-g5a1ee7c. Other devices are laptops and ARM devices with auto-update enabled (currently using syncthing v0.14.23).

I did some searching before posting, but I didn't find any reference of what should happen in this case, either confirming or disproving my experience.
